me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.command

Class SubCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.command.SubCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PermissionConstrainable, PermissionConstrainedCommand

    public abstract class SubCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements PermissionConstrainedCommand
    Represents a command that can be used via a base command. TODO: TSender type argument (validates sender instance, such as players only command) and an Argument class and list.
    Author:
    Glen Husman

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubCommand

        public SubCommand(java.lang.String... aliases)
        Creates a subcommand with the given aliases.
        Parameters:
        aliases - All command aliases, including the main alias as the first element.

    • Method Detail

      • getTabCompletions

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTabCompletions(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                                                 java.lang.String argument,
                                                 java.util.Collection<? extends PermissionConstrainedCommand> possibilities)
        Returns all values in possibilities that have names which start with or equal (ignoring case) the string argument, and which sender has access to as determined by the interface method requirement. This method eliminates possibilities that do not start with the argument as typed so far (disregarding case), as well as arguments which are not permitted to be used by the sender.
        Parameters:
        sender - The sender of this tab completion request. If this argument is null, no permission checks will be performed on elements of possibilities before adding them to the returned list.
        argument - The argument in the command as typed so far. May be null.
        possibilities - All possibilities for the argument, not accounting for the argument so far.
        Returns:
        All possibilities for the argument, accounting for the argument as typed so far. The returned list is guaranteed to be modifiable.

      • getTabCompletions

        @Deprecated
public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTabCompletions(java.lang.String argument,
                                                            java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.CharSequence> possibilities)
        Deprecated. Use StringUtil.copyPartialMatches(String, Iterable, Collection) instead of this method.
        Returns all values in possibilities that start with or equal (ignoring case) the string argument. This method eliminates possibilities that do not start with the argument as typed so far (disregarding case). The collection of CharSequence objects will have each element converted to a string using CharSequence.toString() before adding to the returned list.
        Parameters:
        argument - The argument in the command as typed so far. May be null.
        possibilities - All possibilities for the argument, not accounting for the argument so far.
        Returns:
        All possibilities for the argument, accounting for the argument as typed so far. The returned list is guaranteed to be modifiable.

      • execute

        public abstract void execute(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
           java.lang.String[] arguments)
        Execute this subcommand.
        Parameters:
        sender - The sender of this command.
        arguments - The arguments, including the command name, that were passed to this command. Index 0 will always be the alias of the command that was used in execution.

      • getAliases

        public final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAliases()
        Gets a list of strings which act as aliases for this command.
        Returns:
        A new read only List<String> instance of aliases, including the primary name (first element) of this command.

      • getDescription

        public abstract java.lang.String getDescription()
        Gets a description of the command.
        Returns:
        A description of the command to be displayed in the base command's help page.

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the command, also known as the primary alias.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface PermissionConstrainedCommand
        Returns:
        The primary alias of the command.

      • getUsage

        public abstract java.lang.String getUsage()
        Gets a user-friendly, color-formatted string stating the usage of the command.
        This method will eventually be replaced with a commands argument API, and this method will become final.
        Returns:
        A string representing command usage, usually expressed as mainAlias <arg1> <arg2> [arg3] or mainAlias <arg1> <arg2> <args...>.

      • tabComplete

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> tabComplete(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                                           java.lang.String[] arguments)
        Gets all possible tab completion arguments, given the arguments so far and the sender of the command. The first element of the arguments array will always be the alias of this SubCommand that is used in invokation. The default implementation of this method returns all online players that start with the argument so far.
        Parameters:
        sender - The requester of tab completion options.
        arguments - The arguments passed to the command so far.
        Returns:
        A list of strings which are possibilities for the tab completion argument.
        See Also:
        getTabCompletions(String, Collection)
